page.title: 04FORESTRY _ CONTD
page.content: There are of course, many problems with growing plantation of trees but the wind in these parts can cause severe damage to hectares of the forest. If trees are lost due to damage by gales they loose their value and are more difficult to cut up and handle generally. Oaks and beeches are the hardwoods found round the borders of the existing estate. Thinning out of the trees started twenty five years ago. After this, the trees were thinned every 5 years until they reach forty years of age. They reach a top height of 30 metres. Apart from the problem created by the elements, there are other forces at work which can damage the trees. The fungus, Butt Rot, is a relic of the old woodland site. It attacks the roots and central column of the tree _ the heart wood.
